text:
Looove this place and eeeveryone else who works in Clayton does too (as seen by the line over the lunch hour), but! these people really know efficiency. And are crazy friendly- like friendly to the point of thinking, "ohhh this is what positive customer service looks like!"

Sandwiches are great- you can get something that super fits your restrictive diet or really go to town with a pizza sandwich, shake, and fancy cookie.

Ingredients are always fresh! And get the Voodoo potato chips!

text:
Remember how delicious Subway used to be? Twenty years ago... When the bread was delectably soft and the meats were better than Buddig lunchmeats? (Which I like, but you know it's bottom of the barrel lunchmeats.)

Well, the Subway of yesteryear had faded away, but luckily places like this still exist. With the price hike at Subway, this place is actually competitive in pricing and MUCH better in quality. I was pleasantly surprised and will make this a staple in Clayton when I'm in the area.

text:
Delicious!!! This was my first time trying PotBellys and I had the Pizza Sandwich and it was soo good. I love pizza and sandwiches and putting them together rocked my world. 
The delivery was quick and we had a total of 3 sandwiches and they delivered before estimated time with fresh hot sandwiches. 
I would recommend to anyone in the area close enough to try. Def my new sandwich place. Thank you Potbellys!!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': False}", 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}"}
categories: Salad, Delis, Soup, Restaurants, Food, Desserts, Fast Food, Sandwiches
text: I had to get to work so I hopped on potbelly's app and ordered dinner for myself and my kids. Ordered delivery as I was trying to get ready and seemed the best way to get it done. The app asked what time to deliver, I select ASAP and it tells me about 3:20 pm. Ok cool, I complete my order. Then, I get an email thank me for my order and telling me it should be delivered on 11/11 about 11 am! What?!?! Today is 11/10. That's tomorrow. So I call and Austin answers the phone. I explain to him my problem and he says "yeah our store doesn't air any delivery orders after 2pm" and then asks me if I'd like to switch to carry out or cancel my order and he would not run my card! I asked how long it would be until it was ready and he said an additional 20-25 minutes WOW! I told him never mind and just to cancel. I then clarified that they wouldn't run my card, he said that's correct. Shortly after hangin up I get notification that my card has been charged $44.60. What?!?! I call back and Austin answers again. He explains that it will go away overnight. I explained that wasn't the biggest issue and the fact that their system never told me that they couldn't deliver today but just assumed it was ok to push it back a day, was. His response was that this store doesn't do delivery after 2 pm. I explained again that I was never advised of this before charging my card. "Ma'am I just work here!" I then asked for his manager and he explained he was the manager on duty right now. I asked for the store managers name and contact info. "I can't give that to you!" So now I have no name, no number, had to get food somewhere else and pat yet again.  Absolutely awful experience and unless I hear from the store manager in the am with some sort of apology will never return.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': False}", 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}"}

text: I've eaten at different locations and never had an issue. I just got a sub with Mayo and had to throw it away. It was swimming in it. I've never seen so much Mayo on a sandwich in my entire life. My second issue was that they added tomato, which I didn't want, and left off a topping I had asked for. Be careful what they add to your sandwich here.

text:
Rating: 3.8 Stars

I have had Potbelly Sandwich Shop in the past, and they make good sandwiches. This was my first experience with their Sugar Cookie. As a cookie reviewer, it is my duty to put a review online.

I was given their Sugar Cookie as a thank-you gift. It was just an average sugar cookie. I much prefer sugar cookies that are soft and gooey; this was very crumbly and dried out. I am not sure that I believe that it was baked fresh since it cracked on its own from being dried out. The edges of this Sugar Cookie were the best part. Also, there was too much granulated sugar on top. 

I wish this place was close to the River so that I could try their sandwich more often!

text: Although Potbelly has gotten rid of my beloved turkey club, they're still my favorite go-to. Especially for double points Thursdays (use the app!!!). The customer service here is always above and beyond. They know by name at this point lol and typically have my sandwich ready quickly and with a smile. Light years better than Subway and a better atmosphere. I'm a frequent flyer of Potbelly.

text:
So delicious!
This place kind of reminds me of Quiznos, but it's still got its own unique taste. I recommend this place as it is not too expensive, it's fast, tasty and overall really convenient.
I had a chicken and Chedder sandwich with a lot of topping while Chow R. had the Mediterranean. Both were quite delicious.

text:
Such a good find!!! I was craving something fresh, spicy, delicious-- and this is what we came upon.
Had the Mediterranean sandwich and it was delicious! Satisfied all of my craving and more!

Service 5 very very friendly and helpful 
Food 5 delicious,  fresh!! Chicken slices was so juicy
Price $$ average to reasonable 
Atmosphere very nice, friendly, cheery, casual and clean!!

Will definitely be back, reminds me of a hip Quiznos which I'm perfectly happy with.

categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
This was going to be a 4.5 star review, but I'm rounding up because of the super friendly service and the charity displayed by the man and woman behind the counter in clarifying some questions I had about the company.

I stopped in here on a whim on my drive home, and immediately I was greeted by a friendly guy at the sandwich counter. I told him it was my first time at Potbelly, and he immediately proceeded to give me a rundown of the menu. You choose your sandwich type from a pre-determined list, then your bread (multigrain or white), then have your sub toasted, then finally you choose your condiments. The sandwiches are very reasonably priced, and the condiments (with exception of mushrooms and bacon) are all free of charge.

I got the Mediterranean sandwich with added chicken on the multigrain loaf, then added hot peppers and onions once it was toasted. I think I found my standby -- this sandwich ROCKED. The bread came out of the oven with a beautiful crispness to it, which complimented the hummus perfectly. And the hot peppers? Talk about tasty. It added an ideal "bite" to the sandwich. I'll be ordering this again when I return.

They also offer hands pun shakes/malts, as well as freshly baked cookies. I came around closing time, and the cute woman who rang me up at the register gave me one for free (oatmeal chocolate chip-- delicious) since they were going to be thrown out at the end of the night anyway. Kudos to you, checkout lady.

I had about as ideal of an experience as I could have asked for for my first time in here. I'll certainly be back for more delicious sandwiches (and for that Oreo milkshake, too. My inner Fat Kid must be appeased.)

text: Sandwiches are pretty good, we've eaten at Potbelly before. Unfortunately, their "delivery" option isn't delivery at all. Went through the whole process to order lunch for 5 people on a Friday, filled in all the address and credit card info only to find out delivery is not available. In the online field "Next Available Delivery Times" it was blank and the field grayed out. Every time I hit Submit Order it flashed "Please submit a time for delivery" which I would gladly do if a time was there to select. Bug with the site or they don't actually deliver, hard to tell, but definitely frustrating. Chose another sandwich place to deliver our lunch.

categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
Disclaimer: This review was bumped up a star due to their online ordering system.

My turn to order lunch for my monthly lunch with my fellow executive assistants at work and I need someone to deliver since it's been a bit busy. I heard Potbelly was new in town and whaddaya know, they deliver.

I first pulled up the local shop's online ordering page and it's nothing more than a pdf where you can print it, write in your order and fax it in. Fax it in? I'm not entirely sure I even remember how to use our basically obsolete fax machine. Luckily on the main Potbelly site, you can just click on online orders and get to ordering. Choose your food item, add stuff and take stuff away by clicking or unclicking items. The system lets you name each order too so when it's delivered, each person's lunch is easily identifiable. Here a click, there a click, everywhere a click, click and then you put your c/c info in and voila! 

So the food.....well, I'd say it's average. As others have said, it's similar to Quizno's food but I was hoping for something more and a little different. My sandwich was the Skinny Turkey on thin multigrain bread, no cheese and with pickles, lettuce, tomatoes and hot peppers. Wait, those weren't hot peppers. There's stuff in there that aren't peppers. Don't get me wrong, it was good - but if it's more of a Giardiniera, then say so. The sandwich was juicy and had a good amount of stuff in it. They delivered all the food on time and only messed up one order out of eight. And that was probably just a miscommunication on the online ordering. (I put it in as a sandwich but in the special instructions, I said NO bread, please wrap in lettuce) It came as a salad instead. Oh well.

text: The best sandwich in town! We always get the smallest size of the Mediterranean sandwich which will fill one person up perfectly. I tried a different sandwich (I think the turkey?) and it was just so-so. But you HAVE to try the Mediterranean if you like hummus and/or feta. I am completely hooked on this sandwich! It is a little expensive compared to eegee's or subway but it is a delicious treat to have once in a while. Their coconut pineapple smoothie (while tasting more like a milkshake) is also VERY good and a must try!

categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
We tried Potbelly this weekend, and it was ok.  It is very much like Quiznos, though.  Order your sandwich, someone builds it and shoves it in a salamander, then it gets its toppings and dressings by another employee.  The food quality was a little bit better than a Quiznos or Subway, but it still has that chain, fast food-quality taste.  

Upon entering, you see a relatively small menu.  Not a whole lot of unique sandwich options, which I thought would be the case at a restaurant with such a unique name.  Basically, you get a meat and a cheese.  Nothing really special.  Tried and true toppings like lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo, mustard, pickles, etc. are all available to try to customize your sandwich.  None of it is very exciting.  I honestly could have been in a Quiznos and not really have noticed the difference.  The bread could have set them apart, but it's generic as well.  You can choose between regular white or multigrain, but there's not much to either option.  It does its job to hold the sandwich together.

Everything tasted just fine though.  The sandwich I got, the Clubby, was perfectly edible.

They were generous with the meat and toppings, which was nice.  And the prices were very reasonable.  The restaurant itself was clean and the employees were all very nice.

I guess I went in with too high of expectations.  I thought this was going to be a unique sandwich shop, and it's really just kinda generic.  Would I go back to Potbelly?  Yeah, sure.  Do I actively want to?  No, not really.  There's no "must have" or "OMG THAT'S SO GOOD!!!" or "no one else sells this" kind of sandwich here.

text:
We have frequented this PB many times over the last couple of years.  It is consistently good.  

My only complaints:  (1)  Sometimes the sandwichmakers "forget" to ask you about lettuce, onions, tomatoes, etc.  You have to make a point of telling them (i.e., pay attention don't talk to your wife or buddies) or you will never get them on there.  (2)  It appears that they recently changed their chili recipe.  It used to be delish; now it has a ton of veggies thrown into it, which has altered the flavor and consistency.  I will never order their chili again.

text: With a name like potbelly I was under the impression that there should be of somewhat larger portions. Aside from the smaller than expected sandwich. It was still rather delicious and high in quality as far as my personal sandwich preferences go. They also carry my favorite root beer (IBC) and a uniquely pleasing variety of chips. Great place for a lunch or smaller dinner. There's no signage for the line so you order on the far end.

text: Sooooooo goooooood. The prices are just perfect, and the ingredients, especially the pickles, mustard and hot peppers, are PERFECT. Food is fast, delicious, cheap, and petty much godlike compared to Jimmy John's (across Craycroft) and Subway. I used to live in Chicago a while ago, and I've been waiting for YEARS for Potbelly to arrive in Tucson. It was like a dream come true, and thank GOD it's just as great as I recall.

text: I had a super sweet worker that gave me a free  smoothie after I waited in line for quite a while because the people in front were taking a while to order and figure out what they wanted. I didn't say anything to her about the wait time as this happens often when waiting behind others for food. I have tried other shops in town for the sandwiches and they are really good but thought this went beyond great customer service.

text: Never heard of this place.  My boyfriend and I stopped on a whim, and wanted to try something different.  This place is awesome.  A little pricier than what I expected but the sandwiches were really good.  We both ordered "A Wreck", and boy was it delicious.  The establishment was a bit on the tiny side, but it was very clean and organized.  The customer service was cheerful and welcoming.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
This was my first time at Potbelly. I had a free sandwich coming to me for signing up for the rewards program. The customer service was awesome. Super friendly and helpful and bent over backwards to make me happy. 

The sub itself (The Wreck) was delicious, although I guess all their sandwiches are toasted. I didn't realize that when ordering. I'm not normally a toasted sandwich gal. I would have asked for it not toasted if I had known. The bread is like a french bread, nice and chewy, instead of your typical soft sub roll. Their toppings are pretty basic (which is fine with me, I'm a mayo and pickle kind of girl), and the sandwich choices aren't overly inventive, which is refreshing. They have milkshakes, which you don't typically find in sub shops. I'll have to try one next time. :)

Only two complaints: 
1. no sprite/lemon-lime soda option?! Weird.
2. There was a loud fan-type noise coming from behond the counter that was so loud I couldn't hear the people making my sandwich. I felt silly asking them to repeat themselves over and over. I don't know if it's a temporary issue or part of their equipment. If it's permanent, they need to train their customer service peeps to SPEAK LOUDER.

I'll be back!

Well, this a fun, affordable place- and at the risk of being negative I'm going to say you can't help but notice a few things that don't exactly scream for return business: 

1) the counters are oddly high- someone under 5 ft would probably not return because of this. 
 
1a) the wood potato chip shelf is too obtrusive- I didn't come here to look at potato chips.


2) THERES NO HOT OR ITALIAN PORK

 ( mind officially boggles )

3) took too long - hire an extra set of hands

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
Some notes to speak of, one not so positive... 

1) OUTSTANDING customer recognition and service! Greeted immediately entering restaurant and at every step of the sandwich making process; all with a smile, courteous and genuine can-do attitude. 
2) Comfortable, visually appealing and temperate atmosphere with background music. Add in the Roast Beef sandwich with toppings and you have a perfect rest spot for 30 minutes.
3) 'Military Tuesday'... Win. Love restaurants that recognize national defenders just a few minutes from Davis-Monthan AFB! Love and respect all restaurants that offer this respecting courtesy; makes me want to always come back.
4) 'Egees Killer'. Yep, I said it. While you gotta love Egees, I was very impressed with the quality flavor, fresh breads, and at this time in November; their pumpkin cookie??! Absolutely.
5) The not so positive. The soups are incredibly overpriced for the quantity provided. Clearly a mismatch in which they should likely be around $2.00 cheaper. Not going to detract from my rating however...

*The takeaway? A very, VERY good restaurant, great food, complimentary environment but what so many restaurants lack today is what 'Potbelly's' does so great; 'welcoming attitudes'! Clearly, a well managed staff and at the end of my meal, I had one employee ask me how my meal was... I gave a hearty 'thumbs up'!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
Well, I've eaten at Potbelly's at three different locations now. And I'm just not impressed. My first experience was pretty good. My second one was just OK and you can read my review on that one. This is the third time and location and it was not a charm.

Even though I had a so-so experience last time, Potbelly enticed me in with a free milkshake with a purchase. I had a roast beef sandwich and with every bite I was asking, "Where's the beef?" Could not taste it. I guess the quantity of meat is skimpy. I think about what I could have at say, Jimmy Johns, for the same price, this is skimpy. 

The banana shake was pretty good, though. If I come back, it will only be because I want a milkshake and I don't have a better place to go.

5* = A top favorite. Mind-blowing good. I will definitely return and I will go out of my way to go here. Worth every dime of my money.
4* = Outstanding. Tucson-top-tier. Some elements not quite as good as it gets, but it still is worthy of my regular business.
3* = Good experience. I might do repeat business if it is convenient, the only option, the only one in its category, or on a whim, but would not be among the first thing to come to mind. Would definitely recommend you trying it to get your own take on it.
2* = Not so good. Would not recommend at all. Waste of money.
1* = How are they still in business? Stay away at all costs!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
Okay, Potbelly's opening just make Tucson a better place. Being from mid-west Potbelly is one of my favorite lunch or quick dinner type of place. Maybe they are not the best sandwich shop out there but the consistency stays from Chicago, Livonia to Tucson.

The Italian still taste the same and so is the Oreo shake.....OOO MYYY the Oreo shake. I am smiling now just thinking about how many scoops of ice scream they put that in the blender. And they do one other thing better than in-n-out. If you ask me what it is...Its secret...;)

Now they just need a guy playing guitar by the front door to make it a full Potbelly experience.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
First off, I'm a local business kind of person but I have to say that when there is a "new place on the block" we gotta give it a go.
It's located on the NE corner of Broadway/Craycroft in a stripmall along with the currently infamous, Hobby Lobby. Cute place and nicely decorated with a beautiful potbelly stove right when you enter. Huge menu is displayed high up on the wall as you walk in. Service was both friendly and efficient. The counter that you order at was kind of odd in that it was pretty high up and far from the person that one orders from.  I'm not the tallest person nor am I the shortest, but I still found it awkward to order from such a distance. 
Pretty basic choices but nicely put together. We decided to split a Turkey Breast and Swiss (pretty average ingredient taste, but it's the nicely textured bread that made up for it). Not a very exciting choice I realize, but I was more into wanting to try their soup. We each got a cup to try out, Chicken Noodle (nice amount of veggies, noodles and chicken but very salty) and the Loaded Baked Potato (creamy and tasty but also on the salty side). 
What really stood out on our visit was the Coffee Milkshake that we decided to share. Delicious, thick and sinfully rich. Next time we'll try and keep it to just a smoothie but it'll be difficult.

text: After reading the five existing reviews I have to completely agree with both Lauren and Mark's reviews although I would add this is like an upscale Subway but I would also agree it's more like an upscale Quiznos.  I had the Wreck.  Didn't blow me away however I thought the white bread was surprisingly good, like Italian and crunchy.  3 stars.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
I have been to this shop a lot. It is quite tasty. I like the voodoo chips as they are original. There giardiniera  peppers are awesome and they have great pickles. Can't go wrong with the wreck but I usually get the skinny TKY as it's a great value. 

On a recent visit I decided to use there online ordering just to get some smoothies. That turned into a big headache with some charge issues. I called to rectify and to my shock the employee didn't seem to be capable of correcting the issue. So I left them a deserved negative review. Since then they have reached out and corrected my issue and have said they have increased training on the online billing system to ensure this won't happen to others. So I'm confident this won't happen again.

Long story short go here and get some good food.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop

text: This was my first time here and I was very happy with the experience. The woman who took our orders was very helpful, explaining the different sizes of sandwiches and the choices of toppings. I had 'The Wreck' on flatbread, which is their signature sandwich. My girl friend had a turkey sandwich on regular Italian bread and they were both delicious. She's a big Subway fan and she preferred the sandwich at Potbelly to Subway. I would definitely make this my go to sandwich restaurant.

text: A step above Subway, but just wasn't what I was expecting.  Tried the Wreck and the Pizza Sandwich and I'd recommend the Pizza Sandwich.  I get it fresh ingredients, good quality meats, freshly baked bread blah blah blah.  Recommend giving it a shot but honestly just do see myself returning.  Inviting Staff and restaurant itself is nicely set up, but just didn't make my taste buds water.

text:
The Subs are great here, bring back the pastrami!!!! However when I went to use the restroom (10/9/2016) the cleaning schedule was back dated 10/8/2016. Not a big problem. The problem was:

1. The toilet seat had urine stains that appeared to be there for several days ,and there was "debris" on the back. (No cleaner was available to use)

2. Floors were discolored as if they hadn't been mopped in a while.

3. It was dusty EVERYWHERE inside and outside the bathroom.

Sanitation here is questionable.

 "The bathroom is just as clean as the kitchen."

text: Great customer service!  My payment with a potbelly gift card wasn't going through and before I could even take my wallet out to offer a different form of payment- they comped my entire order.  Staff here are super friendly and have always had a positive experience... not to mention they have the best sandwiches!  Thank you, Potbelly!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
I had never heard of this place... checked out the menu, saw lack of avocado, and had zero interest.

I was already in the parking lot and didn't feel like packing up my kids and heading somewhere else... so decided to check it out.

Well hello, now they have avocado, bonus. The Mediterranean, hummus, red pepper... plus whatever else was in it with avocado! Was so fresh and flavorful. I fell in love. Bread was great. And their spicy peppers are amazing!!! 

I will definitely come back.

Our sandwich maker was impressive, she kept saying ok what else you want... so fast I thought for sure she'd forget something but she got it down!

Really loved the idea of milk shakes and such, not the usual thing you find at similar places. And malt often I struggling looking for malts, I'll def go here for my next craving.

Kids got broc cheese soup... had kind of a funky flavor, like a spice that didn't go well with it.

text: This place is awesome, my new favorite sandwich shop, the workers are alwyas willing to help and recommend stuff. The sandwiches are delicious and the cookies are awesome as well. I would definitely recommend you try it at least once. Plus if you order for a group, I think $20 or more total, they will deliver.

text: I love this place.  I always picked up a sandwich to go at DCA as I was heading back to Tucson.  I can't even begin to tell you how happy I was when this place opened up in my area.  The folks inside are always so friendly. My favorite sandwich is the roast beef loaded with everything on their list.  Keep up the great work!!

text: The place is very cute and clean on the inside. Parking was no issue. The staff were friendly and patient while we figured out what we wanted. The food was delicious. I got the turkey club with avocado, my fiancé got the A wreck one and my son had the pizza sandwich and we loved them. Definitely would go back. The sandwiches were just under $10 for the original size and filled us up

text: I imagine this place gets crowded during the meal hours, but fortunately I didn't have to experience this, as I went in between. Nice atmosphere. Good chicken salad sandwich. Wasn't sure whether to get the peppers as a topping, so they kindly gave me a serving on the side which worked nicely. (As it turned out, I loved the peppers.) Very pleased with the portion size, i.e., not oversized, and with the coffee-flavored malt I ordered. Will go back!

text:
I'm very happy to see Potbelly in Tucson!
I used to frequent Potbelly in Philadelphia and have missed its awesome sandwitches ever since moving back to the west coast. 
This location is doing everything right. I was a little concerned about the quality and service due to it being a brand new store but my they have exceeded my expectations in every aspect. 

The sub I got was made peeerfectly. What sets this location apart from the many others I've been to is the excellent service and the happy people who work here, it's quite amazing. Definitely will be spreading the word : )

text: Yesterday I took my 94 year old neighbor there to have a sandwich I didn't want to mention that my sandwich bread was dry and the sandwich was overall not very good when we got home the 94 year old woman said that was the worst sandwich she had ever had in her life the lady doesn't get out very much so it was really disappointing especially for the prices they charge I never mind spending money for good food however the bread was drying scale stale the portion amount was on the very small side maybe 4 ounces of meat yet the sandwich was almost $7 for the least expensive sandwich very disappointing won't be back

text:
Like others have said, this is basically a step above Subway/Quizno's. Some things of note:

-Very friendly staff.
-Pretty generous portions of meat/vegetables on my sandwich. I forget which one I got, but it was very good and filling.
-Inside decor was inviting and comfortable.

Especially in contrast to the tasteless sandwich factory that is Jimmy John's across Craycroft, Potbelly impressed me. Would recommend/return to eat again.

text: This sandwich shop is so cute. I love to go here for lunch. Their sandwiches are so fresh and yummy. I love their soups too, so flavorful. Today we tried Mediterranean sandwich and garden vegetable soup which helped with my cold!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by my first trip to Potbelly. I knew it was a chain, and I knew it was toasted sandwiches, so I was expecting maybe a Quiznos. I also heard it was "pricey."

Nope.

Five dollars. For that I got a toasted "pizza" sandwich with sauce, pepperoni, meatball bits, cheese, and mushrooms. Ok, I couldn't really taste the mushrooms, but that's not a huge problem for me as I don't really like them.

The biggest issue I had with the sandwich was that the front half of it was pepperoni and the back half was meatball, and at no point was there any overlap. Each bite tended to be one or the other, and the meatball side was much less spicy. Did it ruin the sandwich? No way. I thought it was pretty good, for chain food, and for the low price.

The staff was really, really friendly. The store's interior also had an eclectic style that I liked -- especially large frames containing wallpaper and more, smaller frames. That was weird, and different. There's also a neat old-timey potbelly stove in the entryway. That's clearly where they got their name, although "Conveyor Belt Toaster Sandwich Shop" might be more appropriate.

Overall, a solid 4-star experience and I would be happy to try again for 5.

text: My dad wanted a chicken salad sandwich and I knew just the place. Although I'd never been to this location, I'd just visited a Potbelly in Phoenix and had a great experience so I figured it was fate that there was one just down the street from where we were. I was quite pleased to find the same clean and quaint set up and friendly employees. We took our sandwiches to go and they were as good as expected. We will be back!

text: Went in today around lunch time since I heard great things about this place .Excited great feel and thought wow nice place I order my sandwich asked for tomato's to be put on my sandwich.  Get my order to go only to return to my office to find that they completey left the tomatoes I had requested off of my sandwich.  First and last time I will be here . At least Jimmy Johns or Subway would not make this mistake or even Baggin's.

text: Stopped here for the first time recently and took home two sandwiches. The tuna sandwich was just ok. Better tuna at other places like Jersey Mikes. Hubs had a turkey sandwich and it was pretty skimpy. Extra stars for the friendly, attentive young man who was at the counter and answered my questions with enthusiasm. Place was super clean and plenty of seating. Will give it another try sometime and try their shake and Wreck sandwich.

text: Just way to much  to list. Missing or just minimal toppings,burnt bread,one swipe of avacado,raw bacon(which I paid extra for ) 2 and a half tomatoes for a 12 inch BLT and to add insult to this whole mess I ordered online from work so my wife wouldn't have to wait long to bring it to me. Ordered for pick up at 2 and wife received sandwich at 225/230 while our baby was crying the whole time. Ugh. Not a good first time.

text:
It was a bit too hot to cook dinner so we stopped in for a sandwich. 
First time for us, do we took some time to decide.
My guy went with the Wreck because it has loads of what he loves best. I chose the Veg sandwich with balsamic vinegarette on the side.
I was surprised to see they toast the bread. I like that .
We ate them at home and enjoyed them. 
Next time I'll try that veg sandwich with mushrooms ( they were all out this evening).
I think we'll be back again.

text: After reading the reviews, it seems I'm not the only one who has received poor service here. I think even one customer who is treated poorly is one too many. Someone behind the counter needs to be removed or retrained because my experience with their service was horrible. Forget about the food. Having this bad experience is a turn off altogether.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
First off, this was not what we thought it was going to be: it's NOT a BBQ pork sandwich type place. It's similar to Quizno's. Then, it's also a nation-wide chain.

Once we figured out what kind of sandwiches they sell and how to order, and the woman who was in front of us left because they didn't know the secret ordering she knew in Chicago, we tried to order. The counters are really high so it's hard to see what's going on and I don't like that. I got disconcerted, but finally figured out that the first guy only takes the bread order, then the next guy gets the actual type of sandwich order, at least I think that's how it worked.

Well, once we got past the oven, the guy at the register asked why kind of sandwich we had ordered. I couldn't remember and I hadn't picked the toppings like lettuce, mayo, mustard, etc. I ended up getting too many toppings - the mustard is too strong. It overpowered even the strong meats I had on there. The bread got toasted to the point of being really dry. I don't know if I would liked the sandwich or not, but that mustard! Hubby kinda liked his I think, but I doubt we'll go back because there are so many great local places to get sandwiches here.

I don't like chains.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text: The first time I ever went there I said to myself "self I'm really not sure what's with all this buzz" it was good but nothing that I could remember saying I have to go back. It's similar to subway or Quiznos but they don't go over the top with a million different choices which in my opinion is a good thing. The second time I went it was actually very good and memorable. I got the Italian with hot peppers and I'd say it's unique enough to separate itself from its competitors. The bread has a nice crunch(it's toasted) and the toppings were very satisfying. You can order the original size or big. From the eye test it seems the big is almost twice the size. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a bite especially if you like sandwiches from Jimmy Johns or subway as this is a great alternative.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text: It was horrible.  People at the counter were completely unfriendly.  My salad didn't have key components in it.. I had to go to the counter to let them know and she opened a packet of chicken and chickpeas and gave them to me in a cup without a word.  Then in the middle of my meal I needed a napkin... Couldnt find any. Asked same girl and  she said they were down at the end of the counter in the red container. I went to that spot and the container was empty.  I had to go find her and she copped an attitude when I told her it was empty.  Really!?  Then I opened my soup and it was cold.  Ugh. I was not going back up to the counter. Threw everything in the trash. Oh, and my daughter went to the bathroom and no toilet paper.  Will not be returning. Complete waste of money and crappy service.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
It's an upscale version of quiznos, where you order your sandwich, pick what type of bread you wanted, what cheese you liked in your sandwich then the person will run it through an oven conveyor belt to toast your sandwich. The next person in the sandwich making line will ask you what toppings you want to put on your sandwich, then pass it to the next person (register) asks you if you want to make it a meal (ie. soup, cookie, chips) Then pay a little more that what subway will charge you for a 6 in. sub sandwich. Then off you go!

Don't get me wrong, their bread is soft, their meat (i ordered turkey) is juicy and plentiful and their toppings (all 8-ish of them) is what you normally put on your sandwich. They don't have banana peppers (bummer, i love them) but they have hot pepper mix which is well, spicy which works for me too. You don't really get to see/watch them make your sandwich because their work station is somewhat hidden from view by papercups (and the wall's a little high) lining the whole row of the wall separating you from them. Their sandwich is tasty, and yes, this place is bangin busy (when i went there, couldn't even find an open seat so i just to-go it) but i just don't see all the hype about it. I might come back to try some other sandwich fare they offer, but i really don't foresee myself being all addicted and all up hipster on them.

text: Great little spot for a nice lunch! I'm not big on samdwiches in general but I really enjoyed my food here. Menu has a wide variety of selections. If you aren't sure what to get, the crew will recommend something that will satisfy your pallet. Restaurant is always clean and provides for a laid back atmosphere. Nice place overall!

text: Wanted something quick for lunch and decided to try a new place... BEST decision ever... I got the pepperoni sandwich, the turkey club sandwich(You HAVE to add the hot peppers, pickles on the side) & the cheddar broccoli soup.. Everything was delicious but my fav was the Turkey Club and the cheddar broccoli soup.. omg it was amazing, real big chunks of turkey in the sandwich and real whole pieces of broccoli in the soup. I will definitely come back again.

text:
This took me back to my favorite lunch time spot when I lived in Chicago! I am so happy to see that the sandwiches taste the same. That the milkshakes have the two little cookies on the straws. And that the live music is still there! Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Thank you so much for opening up here in Tucson. This will now be my new most frequented lunch spot!  
The sandwiches are fabulous. I always get the turkey with cheddar or American. No hot peppers for me but a little bit of a hot pepper sauce is just the right kick.

text:
If I could rate this place lower than 1, I would. The prices are too expensive for the amount of food served. I will never come here again. It's like a more expensive Subway (and I HATE Subway).

I also REALLY don't like the fact that patrons cannot see what the sandwich makers are doing while employees making the food. Can't see the ingredients. Can't see the work space. My husband is 6ft., 3in., and he couldn't see behind the counter, either. 

I mean, the good news is that I didn't get sick. The better news is that I now know not to ever come here again.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
Sooo good!! 1000 times better than subway or any other sub place. I used to live in chicago and ate at potbelly at least once a week. This place is like the chipotle of sandwiches . Consistent, fresh, fast and friendly!

All subs toasted as u move down the line, the italian hot peppers really make the sandwich addicting! No skimping on the meat either!

This place should have a cult following like its other locations in chi town. I wish and pray they make it to LA. Yes i would drive the 405 traffic in LA just for this food.... Its that yummy. Go here u will not regret it.

My top fav... Wreck on wheat. And a side of chicken noodle soup! Peace out....

text: To the amazing, loving, beautiful, employee here at Pot Belly's, thank you! I'm sorry I didn't get your name but thank you for offering us stickers, Apple sauce, and a toy dinosaur to my fussy toddler. My husband and I appreciate your kindness! We came to eat and had my son doing social distancing learning, we are from California, and I had my hands full with him on the laptop. My husband was attending to the baby girl but you know how it is when the baby's want momma.  You have no idea how you blessed our day.

attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}

text: I just started goin here as it's super close to my house and they have a really great app for ordering pick-up.  Only order sandwiches and cookies here.  Everything else sucks.  The salads are pretty lack luster and small.  I got a birthday perk recently so just tried their shakes.  I added a note to make it "thick please" and it came out like chocolate milk with some pulverized oreos mixed in.  The potato soups had like three tiny chunks of potatoes in it, the rest was floury soup base.  The sandwiches are far better than Jersey Mike's and you're able to customize them better in the app too.  The brownie cookies are amazing.  I love that you can just run inside and grab you to-go from the cubby.  I'll be trying the mac and dream bars next, but based on my experience, the sandwiches are the shining star items here.

text: I used to go here all the time, But haven't been able to order anything since Covid hit. Their website will show that they're open and offering delivery but then when you try and make a delivery order it's not available or the store is closed. name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
It's always nice to have new places come to town and I had heard a lot of ballyhoo  about Potbelly, much like when In-N-Out first came to town. Having lived in Tucson most of my life, I would probably feel the same way if I moved to Chicago and heard eegee's was coming to town.

When I go into a place for the first time and I know it's a chain, my expectations are usually set at three stars. Potbelly did  nothing to fall short of or exceed those expectations. I have been twice and had the Clubby and the Wreck. The first time (Clubby - yes, it's a club sandwich) I just got the sandwich the way it was presented on the menu, with lettuce tomatoes and ranch dressing. It was a very average sandwich. The next time I got The Wreck on multigrain, with salami, turkey, roast beef and Swiss. I fixed it up my way with all the fixin's and "hot peppers". I use quotes because they use more of a giardineira, with other stuff in in like olives and carrots (they sell bottles of it in store). I only bring this up because, if you order hot peppers, are expecting just peppers, don't like all that stuff or can't have it, you will avoid being surprised.

The Wreck, "my way", was a more successful sandwich, but still just didn't blow me away, although I would probably get it again. Along those lines, my wife is a meatball sandwich lover, so we will have to visit so she can try their meatball sandwich. That'll give me a chance to work my way through some of the menu to see if there is something that will change/blow my mind. I think that's pretty doubtful though...

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}", 'WiFi': "'free'", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'HasTV': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "'none'", 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': 'None', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}"}
categories: Desserts, Delis, Restaurants, Soup, Salad, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food
text:
I could easily get my own potbelly, just by eating too much of Potbelly's! 

Full disclaimer, I order the same sandwich EVERY SINGLE TIME and have no plans to try other items on the menu, so this review is based upon that particular sandwich and the consistency of this particular Potbelly's chain.

My order is the Wreck, with all toppings except for tomato:
"Our signature sandwich! Salami, Angus roast beef, oven roasted turkey, hickory smoked ham with melted Swiss cheese toasted and then topped with fresh lettuce, tomato and mayo on multigrain". The way they toast the sandwich to perfection gets me every time, and their in house peppers are AWESOME! I recommend getting the peppers on the side if your spice tolerance isn't the greatest like mine, so you can control your own heat. You can also buy jars to take home!

Compared to the other sub shops in town, this is my personal favorite. The line is always quick, they have rewards if you're into that sort of thing, and it tastes the same every time (even when I have tried locations out of state). The establishment is always clean, well branded (love the cute little potbelly stove in the front of the shop to tell their story), and the staff is friendly without being overbearing.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': 'None', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True'}
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Soup, Fast Food
text:
Sorry, this place is going to be a hard pass for me. I've never had an $8 sandwich this skimpy before. I ordered the Pizza sandwich, and when you closed the roll, you couldn't even see the filling, and this was the 'bigs'. It looked like what amounted to 2 pieces of capicola, a few rounds of pepperoni and what appeared to be a slice and a half of cheese. That was topped with roughly half a crumbled up meatball. 

What saved this review from being 1 star was the marinara sauce, which had a good flavor, but when the bread makes up the majority of your sandwich, it'll be a long time before I go back.

I'd recommend going to a Subway before I'd suggest Potbelly. And I'm not a fan of Subway. I even deleted the Potbelly app from my phone.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': 'None', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True'}
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Soup, Fast Food
text: Completely done with this establishment after my experience today. We work above this location and have been ordering from here since they opened. At 11:40am today we placed a nice size order to be picked up around 12:15pm. When we went down stairs to pick up we were told the manager was currently making the sandwiches and he refused to complete our order because it was not put in the computer. The woman who took our ordered had written it down because we still wanted to get drinks and chips/cookies. We were then told the district manager was giving us the order for free and they would start working on the order at this time. At this time it was around 12:20 pm. We waited an additional 20 minutes and still had received any type of call saying we could pick up. We proceeded to go down again and were told he was still refusing to make the order. They then had to pull someone else to make the sandwiches because he did not want to do so. After an additional 10 minutes we were given the soups and told the sandwiches would be brought up. The manager's excuse was that several people quit/called out. Regardless if this were the case or not his behavior was completely unacceptable. I get having to wait a little bit, but not getting our full lunch order for almost 2 hours is completely inexcusable. Definitely will not be giving them anymore business

text: I love Potbelly's but the service here is pretty bad.  The employee making our sandwiches was awesome and super friendly. The guy checking us out (and making the milkshake) was bad.  I'm assuming he was running shift because he held the keys but our vanilla milkshake was made incorrectly (or the blender wasn't clean). When our sandwiches were ready, he was MIA and took 5-10 minutes for him to show up again. When he handed us our milkshake, he didn't say anything about the wait or thank us. We filled out the survey and ask d for a call back. It's been over a week and not a word.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'GoodForKids': 'True', 'Ambience': 'None', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'False', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True'}
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Soup, Fast Food
text:
Short reviews I can make interesting and informative. But super short reviews I really try not to do... But for the life of me, I can't think of much to say about this place....
This was my first time stepping into a Potbelly. Great looking interior, and super friendly/helpful staff... The menu looked great. It almost seemed as if my sandwich was going to be hand carved, sliced off the bone, and crafted with care... That's what I get for having such high expectations while looking at these businesses from afar for years. There was nothing these workers did wrong. They we're just using the tools provided and following the script.... Thanks guys. 
What I paid for was a sad looking meal consisting of pre-sliced and pre-packaged everything... 
In short, this brand is nothing more than a Subway with a much cooler name and atmosphere. 
I came. I saw. I hate to say that I was disappointed.... 
But if I'm ever really drunk early one afternoon and looking for a quick bite to eat, this is my place!! 
In that order, and only under those conditions.

text: This chain started the toasted sandwich revolution. I'm a big fan of their pb & jelly sandwich and milkshakes. Prices can be a bit high for this chain, which is unfortunately why I think there aren't really any around the Philadelphia area.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text: I don't know how fair this review will be considering I've only ever really ordered one thing at Potbellys, but I love that one thing so much that it's worth a review! The uptown salad is my go-to item on their menu. The apples, grapes, blue cheese, cranberries and candied walnuts (MAKE SURE YOU GET THESE), all with the chicken and balsamic dressing go so well together and make for the perfect lunch that hits the spot. The chicken enchilada soup is also super yummy, and their frozen drinks are always a treat, although I would say their fruit smoothies taste more like milkshakes. Overall fast and reliable in the middle of the work day!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
This place is hit-or-miss.  Usually a hit but when it's a miss it's often by a lot.

HITS:  Prices are good.  I can get a BIG salad, bag of chips and a drink cheaper than just a salad from other places close to campus.  Online ordering - saves a LOT of time when you go to pick up during peak pick-up times (see MISSES for more about that).  Convenient location (on campus, across from both HUP & CHOP), fresh & good tasting food.

MISSES: Because of the way it's set up you may sometimes tell three different people what you want before the person who's going to make your salad asks you what you want (order online, you won't have this problem).  If you go anytime between 11:30 and 1:30 it gets CROWDED (again, order online).  If you go at non-peak times and don't order online the staff might not be helpful (case in point, I was in there yesterday with SIX people not doing anything and no one would take my or the guy in front of me's order).  Occasionally the online order gets "lost" and isn't ready for pick up (on the upside they will move you to the front of the line and make it pronto -- this has happened more than 3 times, it wasn't a fluke incident).

Overall, it's a decent place on Penn's/UPHS campus.  Food is tasty & cheap.  I use a meeting at the hospital to get a chicken salad salad a few times a month and I've been known to trek over there for food even when I don't have a meeting.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
It's like the better Subway.

Potbelly has high quality sandwiches made at the speed of any fast food sandwich shop. It's like someone took Subway and said, "I can do that better."

They have a decent selection of sandwiches, a couple of soups, some macaroni salad, and cookies. Oh, and their shakes are the awesomeness.

Great spot for that quick sandwich that sticks to your ribs.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
Potbelly Sandwich Shop should execute a solid meal at a reasonable price. 

I stopped by for lunch during a recent visit at HUP. This place is just a short walk over the skybridge from the hospital. The restaurant is clean with plenty of seating outside and limited seating inside. The only complaint I have on a restaurant logistics standpoint is that the restrooms are quite a trek away across Penn Tower.

The ordering experience is streamlined nicely. It works much like your typical national sandwich joint. Order, move down the line, and pick your toppings. Pro tip: if you order a whole pickle, the staff will announce it in unison. That was entertaining in and of itself. I ordered a sandwich, a whole pickle, and a coffee. That came out to $6.97. It can be difficult to go out to lunch for under $7 anymore. I think that price is more than fair. 

I would describe my food as okay. The coffee and the pickle were good, but the sandwich was underwhelming. I had the Skinny T-K-Y with a little bit of mayo, lettuce, and tomato on a multi-grain roll. My roll had a slight plastic taste, like it sat in a bag too long. The roll was also on the dry side. Otherwise, the sandwich was balanced as far as meat, cheese, and veggies go, but it really lacked flavor. It just didn't have that wow factor.

The last point I want to touch on is service. I have a hospitality background, so my expectations on service tend to be high. This place just lacked a certain fluidity that I believe is found in good service. The staff didn't always engage in an upbeat and positive manner, although they weren't negative either. They also didn't have a sense of guiding customers through the ordering process, which I believe is critical. Like the food, the service wasn't outstanding but was not awful either.

If you're looking for a quick meal that has good value in the HUP area, this restaurant is a safe choice. That said, I would rather explore the other options in the area for something more creative, tasty, and executed with more attention.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
Best sandwiches I've ever had. They toast them, which is a huge plus, and there are a huge assortment of toppings (oregano, oil, peppers, lettuce, onion, mayo, mustard etc.).

They also give you the option of adding mushrooms or bacon for a little extra.

Delicious whole pickles available is an additional plus.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
Great sandwiches!  Delicious cookies!  $1 bags of chips!  Cream Soda!

I had never been to Potbelly before, but I will definitely go back.  The grilled chicken with cheddar was delightful.  I got mine with tomato and mayo on Italian bread.  The bread was toasted to perfection.  

My only complaint, and it's more of a caveat than anything else, is the ordering system.  It's not rocket science, but it's good to know that there is a unique system to ordering.  You order your sandwich first.  Just the basic "I'm having turkey" or whatever.  You can also pick up your drink there from the cooler.  Next, you order your condiments / extras (lettuce, tomato, onion).  There is also a display of chips to choose from (only $1).  Finally, you put it all together and pay.  We were fine, but the family in front of us (who had to be from out of town, on a college visit, and mom was definitely a helicopter parent), seemed terribly confused.  

Anyway, I will probably be here again soon.  It's right inside the hospital grounds, so if you need to visit a friend or get testing done, it's a great lunch spot that is super convenient.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HasTV': 'False', 'WiFi': "'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True'}
categories: Delis, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Fast Food
text:
Solid and prompt.  One of the best non-food-truck places to grab a meal in the Penn/HUP area. The sandwiches are good, the salads are good, the desserts and shakes are good. My favorites are the Wreck and the Roast Beef sandwiches. ALSO: hot peppers!!!

I do have the suspicion that the sandwiches are getting smaller each time I go. Somehow the sandwich still manages to be a satisfying meal.

Beat the lunch rush by going at 11:30 or 1:30 instead of noontime. It makes a huge difference.
