categories: Fast Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Delis, Food, Vegetarian, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Soup
text:
One night after The Wife moved back from Chicago she suggested we go to Potbelly for dinner. My response was something along the lines of, "Wtf is a Potbelly?" 

Stunned that I wasn't familiar with, like, the greatest sandwich shop in the known universe, duh, and saddened by the fact that chain had yet to add a link in Indianapolis, she spent the next four years extolling the virtues of Potbelly at every opportunity.

Here's the skinny - in 1977, a couple starts selling sandwiches our of their antique shop and names the enterprise after an antique cylindrical style of oven. Fast forward 20 years and they sell the concept to a guy who turns it into a 200-shop chain. They mostly sell baked sandwiches with good ingredients and killer giardiniera relish, Zapp's chips, and cookies and shakes. And as of May 3, 2011, they are open for business in Indianapolis.

After four years of hype it was going to be hard to impress me but my first Potbelly impression was strong. The sandwiches are good (I think. When you put giardiniera on anything it just tastes like something with giardiniera on it.), reasonably sized, and cheap for what you get - I walked out of there with dinner for two for less than I'd spend in Subway. 

I can't weigh in on whether Potbelly is the best sandwich shop in the known universe, but it's definitely the best option in the context of Subway, Jimmy John's, et al.

text:
I was in Indianapolis for the weekend for a Conference and we needed to find some place to eat dinner that was cheap and close. We chose to go to Potbelly. As a group of 14 we were all able to sit in the restaurant and each order what we wanted with a cheap price tag. It was just a short walk from the Convention Center and Stadium. The circle was also decorated for Christmas, which was pretty. 
I got the Mediterranean  sandwich with a peppermint milkshake and it was delicious. Some of the members in my group got the big pickles and were excited to eat them.  The staff was very welcoming and nice. One of the guys even came out to see how we liked the meal. 
The second night we were Indianapolis we didn't have plans for dinner as a chaperone we asked where every one wanted to go for dinner. It was a unanimous vote to return to Potbelly's! This was a great opportunity for my to try something different. I got the meatball sub which was just as good! 
Two nights in a row Potbelly's Sandwiches proved to be the restaurant of choice for my group and I am sure that when the conference is back in Indianapolis we will be regulars there again. It is a great restaurant for picky people that want to have something specific or anyone that just wants a really good warm meal.

text:
Was looking for a great sandwich shop in Indy while on business.  By far the best subs in town. These sandwiches are pure toasted goodness.  

Get the extra mayo, extra oil on the roast beef and you will be blown away!  Wash it down with a chocolate malt and the oatmeal chocolate chip cookies... pure bliss.

The staff was very nice and efficient just after the store opened the first week of May.

text: Potbelly sandwich shop is right at downtown monument circle. I love eating out at potbelly. The restaurant is small with seating for up to 10-15 people max at a time. The have really nice sandwich, salad and soup options. I will recommend chicken salad salad which is my favourite here along with  Farmhouse salad. The have 4-5 types of soup and my favorite is Chicken Enchilada soup. They also make fresh milkshakes for your sweet tooth cravings and they are delicious they classis vanilla which is my favorite along with coffee, oreo and strawberry milkshakes. There is parking lot for this place so you have street pay and park or any garage near by. The service time is fast and staff is always helpful and friendly. A must visit place if you have never been here.

text: Food did not survive long enough for a photo opp. Walking in smelled yummy. Waited a bit of time in line but in the end so worth it. We ordered the chicken and cheddar and the Italian. Both were delicious. Unfortunately they ran out of provolone so I was given a cookie to make up for the inconvenience. The cheddar substituted did add a different flavor to the Italian but it was still very tasty. The employees although working hard, were still very friendly and we did have good conversation. All in all a great place to get a yummy sandwich if in the area.

text:
1st timers on the 4th of July too! Yay for me!

I love this place! Do I love it as much as Baguette de France? No.
But until BdF comes to town, they have my business.

Delicious whole grain bread, freshly toasted. Get it extra wet
on the oil/vinagrette w/ all the extras. Wife loves the fresh avocado
while we wait. 

Great service. Great people working and having fun.
Great food. We are very happy to have found the place.

How did we find? Yelp Nation. 
Why? Every other place we wanted was closed for holiday!

Thanks guys! Great job - we'll be back!

text:
Well when you walk in it has a smoky ambiance,  I take it,  it's for show because none of the meats can possibly be fresh cooked. I got the "a wreck" and the meats are not fresh cooked. 
The sandwich itself was quite small maybe 7in.  Price was ok. And the flavor was good enough that I did finish it.  

Just disappointed that it's not all fresh meats. 
Would I come back, probably not. 

Would recommend if you are looking for a step up from Quiznos. Only because of the music based decor

text:
I stopped by here on a recent weekend trip for what I anticipated to be a quick lunch. However, I didn't expect to be greeted by a 3-piece bluegrass band offering live music as well. And they were really good! Usually if you get live music at a restaurant it can be loud and annoying. I sat and watched those guys a good 15 minutes after I was done eating. I would've stayed longer but the crowd was picking up and felt I should offer up my table to someone else wanting to eat their lunch.

Now let's get on to the sandwich. I had a meatball with mushrooms, bacon, and hot peppers. Perfection. Sweet, savory, and spicy. Make sure you try the VooDoo kettle chips. It was like a mixture of barbecue and salt 'n vinegar. Very good!

text: So excited to have this yummy chicago based sandwich chain in Indy. If you have flown through Midway airport then you have probably seen Potbellys. I've been obsessed with the vegetarian sandwich for years. My kids love the shakes and the cookies. Its a great place for kids with warm peanut butter and jelly and pizza sub options. And perfect location to grab a sandwich and eat on on the circle. Go you wont be disappointed.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'HasTV': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'DriveThru': 'True'}

text: My boyfriend adores Potbelly Subs, and normally he thinks they can't do wrong, but when we came to this store during a trip downtown it was a mess. His sandwich was completely subpar, and the avocado on my sandwich (which I paid extra for) was so under ripe that there was seriously pit stuck to a chunk that was like biting into celery. It was disgusting. I may go back to a Potbelly Subs restaurant again, but I don't think it will be the one on Monument Circle.

text:
Love the meatball and a shake. I have tried a few other menu items here as well and like the ones I have tried. Hot Peppers is a great add to almost any dish they serve up. 

Whenever we'd go to Chicago, we'd almost always stop for a Potbelly meal. It was great when they came to Indianapolis- and we have a few locations now. I hope to see a few more soon - but not too too many...

text: The Monument Circle location makes this an ideal lunch spot in downtown Indy. The best order is the turkey sandwich with provolone, hot peppers, and mustard and voodoo chips. So spicy but so delicious!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop

text: This is my first time having a sandwich from Potbellys. I have heard of them and actually thought the food would be bad. It was awesome! Im from out of town staying in a hotel and was exhausted from my flight and they delivered by food to me in less than 10 minutes. I had the Mediterranean signature sandwich and added chicken. Everything is so fresh and the hummus is a little spicy, the way I like it! Will definitely be ordering again!

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'HasTV': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'DriveThru': 'True'}
categories: Fast Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Delis, Food, Vegetarian, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Soup
text: My first time the staff was rude. I asked how to order and they told me it's further back in the line. Again, I had no idea, but the tude was not needed. I don't like how You can't see what they are putting on my sandwich. When i saw it come out the oven there was barely any marinara. I ordered the pizza sub. I told them to add more with a please. Weird so don't judge me but i always add mustard to my meatball subs... so i asked for mustard. Got my sandwich and my fountain drink iced tea. It's a five minute walk back to my office. I take a sip of my drink and my tea is unsweetened. There wasn't a sign saying it was not sweetend. I go into subway and asked if i could use their fountain to replace my drink. They didn't hesitate to say yes. Then i checked my bag to see if anything else is missing. There are no napkins in my bag either. I grab napkins too. Once I get to my desk, i take a bite and it taste ok. Needed more marinara and meatballs were super flat. Opened my sub and looked like they cut up the meatballs. They also FAKE put mustard on my sandwich!!! Why couldn't he tell me they ran out. I heard the bottle fart and everything. He sold me! I won't be eating here again. Let's go subway

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
attributes: {'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'", 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'OutdoorSeating': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'HasTV': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}", 'CoatCheck': 'False', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'DriveThru': 'True'}
categories: Fast Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Delis, Food, Vegetarian, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Soup
text: We used to order Potbelly daily often 2 x a day, but now lucky if we order 2 x a month. the delays are horrendous todayfor instance 45 min for a salad.dont even think about asking for extra you will get charged but wont get the extra, the personwho picks up the phoe can never take your oder you are put on hold for what seems like eternity and its really unfortunate....and if you fill out an email on their website you will be met with a curt response of mgr..... call Jimmy Johns....

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop

text: I'm always resistant to rate 5 stars, but this place is really good and the staff is incredible. We went there while looking at Monument Circle Lights and they were crowded, but service was quick, professional and very personal. He let me taste the meats that were on my sandwich. I had the Italian and it was so good. Cool atmosphere as well. Also, try the coffee milkshake as well. It's good.

text: Great sandwich shop! I did an online order for pickup and that was such an easy process. We got two sandwiches, a cookie (yum), and milkshakes (double yum)! This is a great lunch spot!

text: Their food is good but their customer service is atrocious. I called and placed an order with a very nice employee but when I showed up was told by the male presenting manager that they stopped taking phone orders at 11, which was just not true. I then called the same number I had used before and he answered so there's no way I went to the wrong place. I have had a great experience eating food here in the past but I believe I can find the same quality food with nicer management elsewhere.

text:
Was attending an event on the circle and wanted something quick to eat. Potbelly was right there so we gave it a try. 
I ordered the Italian on original bread. (a baguette) It is capicola, mortadella, pepperoni and salami with provolone cheese. The meat to bread ratio was terrible. All bread and hardly any meat. So depressing to spend over $7 on bread! 
The positive is the line moves really quick. We were lined out the door and was out in less than 15 minutes.

text: I love this restaurant so much! The sandwiches are incredible and your given more options than any other sandwich shop I am aware of. I love building what sounds awesome in the moment The soup selection is big and I've had several choices ALL top shelf. I ordered a pound of salami last time it was fantastic and as much as Kroger! Should have got this time now that I mention it. The thing's I've mentioned are a glimpse check them out you'll be glad you did.

text: Potbelly catered our business lunch, for which I was responsible. I placed the order an hour in advance for 10 people. When I arrived to pick up, the restaurant was super busy with the lunch crowd and I was immediately notified that they're working on my order. It took only 10 minutes longer than expected, but the staff thanked me for my patience and kindly gave me a voucher for two free sandwiches in the future. Everything in the catering order was labeled, organized and was a hit with the staff. The food was good and the Mediterranean Chicken sandwich was my personal favorite.

text:
One rainy night, we ventured downtown for a Pacers game. Every restaurant we tried to get into had more than an hour wait. That's when my genius husband mentioned Potbelly. We walked in, were immediately greeted and the best part...no line. We actually had time to sit down and eat before the game! 
Service was fast and friendly. The food was delicious! Too bad that I don't live or work downtown. I would eat here on a weekly basis.

text:
For a chain this is fantastic. If you come in during lunch hour they have someone at the door taking orders in line so that by the time you're up front the sandwich is made and ready to be dressed. The hot peppers are amazing, but watch out, they mean hot. The price on the sandwiches are pretty good as well. This will be a regular place when I need a really quick lunch.

One more interesting point. During lunch they usually have live music. Crazy right?

text: Dear Potbelly, The staff at this location is wonderful. The food was amazing. Ummmmm.... Can you take a look at the entance and Interior? I was afraid to enter and order food here. The well-put-together saff madce me feel a bit at ease. The food was good, but the fact that more than one person knowing to come in and ask for the bathroom key did not make me feel warm and fuzzy. Luckily for me, I did not have to use the bathroom while I was there. The crochet lady sitting out front helped me find my way in. Can we buy her lunch?

categories: Fast Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Delis, Food, Vegetarian, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Soup
text:
I've been ordering from the one on the circle and prior to that the one in Bloomington for several years.  Online ordering is nice. Most of the food was just OK for me, but the Broccoli soup was awesome. There are other places around that I prefer, but went to them because they delivered and offered online ordering.  I have had several issues at both locations with Delivery.  I've had a delivery (for myself and several co-workers) canceled.  I received a call nearly an hour after the estimated delivery time saying they were too busy to deliver.  They canceled the order but it took several days to get the refund.  

Another time I was told I was outside their delivery area despite multiple orders at the same address in the past. I think it depends on the staff working that day as to what their delivery criteria/rules are.  If you don't need delivery I'd go somewhere else.  If you do need delivery call to order rather than place online.  And in a pinch Jimmy Johns usually delivers within 15 minutes, which was what I had to do each occasion they chose not to deliver.  Due to the delivery issues I will not be back at either location.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop

text:
I have always been a huge fan of Potbelly! Their sandwiches are all on point and no matter which one you chose, you'll be happy. Typically, I have found myself to be very happy with the quality and the taste of these sandwiches, and it's easily my favorite sandwich place in Indy. 

Today I ordered delivery and my sandwich was delicious, but without the hot peppers that I had requested. However, something was super wrong with the tomato soup -- it was incredibly sour! 

Regardless of the issue, I'll still be back many times.

We really enjoyed our meal.  No problem there.  The problem, which Potbelly's may not be able to control but they still have to live with, are the homeless who camp in front of their door.  We shouldn't have to fight so hard just to enter the business.  

We will likely try again next time we're downtown but hope for a better experience.  Again...the "Wreck" sandwich was very good!

categories: Fast Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Salad, Delis, Food, Vegetarian, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Soup
text:
I was in the downtown Indianapolis area on the circle and stopped to have lunch. This is my second trip to the shop.

Both times in the shop it has been very busy because it has been on a work day. I think it is all about getting people through the line quick. Which is a good thing for people who work downtown.

I had the pick a pair which is a half sandwich and half soup or half salad. I had the meatball sandwich and a farmhouse salad with Potbelly vinaigrette. I also had a short shake in Oreo. 

My sandwich was good and filling although a bit messy. The salad was in a good size bowl for the money. The shake was good and it had a little cookie on top of it!

If you are looking for a quick and tasty lunch this is a good place to go. If you are trying to park downtown on the circle or anywhere near it on a work day then good luck.
